item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 316
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. HEADLINES 2. STAR CONTRIBUTORS 3. CONTRIBUTION STATS 4. GUESTS 5. LANGUAGES 6. CENTURION CLUB 7. DAMIAN CONWAY’s CORNER 8. ANDREW SHITOV’s CORNER 9. PERL SOLUTIONS 10. RAKU SOLUTIONS 11. PERL & RAKU SOLUTIONS HEADLINES Thank you Team PWC for your continuous support and encouragement. STAR CONTRIBUTORS Following members shared solutions to both tasks in Perl and Raku as well as blogged about it.

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 11, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 10 | Day 11 | The gift is presented by Adam Russell. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 313. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Reverse Broken Keys for Letters The examples used here are from the weekly challenge problem statement and demonstrate the working solution. Part 1: Broken Keys You have a broken keyboard which sometimes type a character more than once.

item.title: Advent Calendar 2025
item.description: | 2019 | 2020 | 2021 | 2022 | 2023 | 2024 | 2025 | Here we are, kicking off another Advent season. It’s amazing to look back and see how far we’ve come - and none of it would have been possible without the energy, passion, and teamwork of everyone in Team PWC. Thanks for bringing the magic to life once again! MON

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 10, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 9 | Day 10 | Day 11 | The gift is presented by W. Luis Mochan. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 312. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Task 1: Minimum Time You are given a typewriter with lowercase english letters a to z arranged in a circle. Typing a character takes 1 sec.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - Guest Contributions
item.description: As you know, The Weekly Challenge, primarily focus on Perl and Raku. During the Week #018, we received solutions to The Weekly Challenge - 018 by Orestis Zekai in Python. It was pleasant surprise to receive solutions in something other than Perl and Raku. Ever since regular team members also started contributing in other languages like Ada, APL, Awk, BASIC, Bash, Bc, Befunge-93, Bourne Shell, BQN, Brainfuck, C3, C, CESIL, Chef, COBOL, Coconut, C Shell, C++, Clojure, Crystal, CUDA, D, Dart, Dc, Elixir, Elm, Emacs Lisp, Erlang, Excel VBA, F#, Factor, Fennel, Fish, Forth, Fortran, Gembase, Gleam, GNAT, Go, GP, Groovy, Haskell, Haxe, HTML, Hy, Idris, IO, J, Janet, Java, JavaScript, Julia, K, Kap, Korn Shell, Kotlin, Lisp, Logo, Lua, M4, Maxima, Miranda, Modula 3, MMIX, Mumps, Myrddin, Nelua, Nim, Nix, Node.

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 9, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 8 | Day 9 | Day 10 | The gift is presented by Roger Bell_West. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 311. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Iâ€™ve been doing the Weekly Challenges. The latest involved case swapping and character grouping. (Note that this ends today.) Task 1: Upper Lower You are given a string consists of english letters only.

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 8, 2025
item.description: Advent Calendar 2025 | Day 7 | Day 8 | Day 9 | The gift is presented by Jaldhar H. Vyas. Today he is talking about his solutioni to The Weekly Challenge - 310. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2025 from the original post. Challenge 1: Arrays Intersection You are given a list of array of integers. Write a script to return the common elements in all the arrays.
